descriptions.b_1_desc: Maximum level is 10, except capital — limited by stockyards there.
descriptions.b_2_desc: Maximum level is 10, except capital — limited by stockyards there.
descriptions.b_3_desc: Maximum level is 10, except capital — limited by stockyards there.
descriptions.b_4_desc: Maximum level is 10, except capital — limited by stockyards there.
descriptions.b_5_desc:
Increases lumber production in village.
Bonus from oases is added, not multiplied.
descriptions.b_6_desc:
Increases clay production in village.
Bonus from oases is added, not multiplied.
descriptions.b_7_desc:
Increases iron production in village.
Bonus from oases is added, not multiplied.
descriptions.b_8_desc:
Increases crop production in village.
Bonus from oases is added, not multiplied.
descriptions.b_9_desc:
Increases crop production in village.
Bonus from oases is added, not multiplied.
descriptions.b_10_desc:
Limits maximum amount of resources available in village.
When no stockyards, capacity is 800.
descriptions.b_11_desc:
Limits maximum amount of crop available in village.
When no stockyards, capacity is 800.
descriptions.b_12_desc:
Troops' weapons are enhanced here. Each village has separate upgrades.
Upgrades remain after this building is torn down, but vanish after conquer.
descriptions.b_13_desc:
Troops' armors are enhanced here. Each village has separate upgrades.
Upgrades remain after this building is torn down, but vanish after a conquer.
descriptions.b_13s_desc:
Troops' armors and weapons are enhanced here. Each village has separate upgrades.
Upgrades remain after this building is torn down, but vanish a conquer.
descriptions.b_14_desc:
Increases army speed, but only for part of distance exceeding 30* squares. Doesn't affect merchants.
* - 20 in T4.
descriptions.b_15_desc: Affects construction speed of other buildings. Building speed is 5x slower on 0th level (destroyed) comparing to 1st level.
descriptions.b_16_desc: In T4 rally point level N detects types of units in incoming attacks, unless there are ≥ N units in that attack.
descriptions.b_17_desc:
Could be used as extra stockyard (but not a cranny!), by placing sell offer.
Keep in mind, that those resources could be stolen in raid.
descriptions.b_18_desc: Limits maximum alliance size. Embassy with maximum level among all alliance members is considred, not only from the founder's villages.
descriptions.b_19_desc:
Once troops queued for training, their training time won't be changed disregarding of further changes in barracks level, effect from artifacts or items(T4).
Even if barracks would be demolished, troops training will be continued.
On classic (2.5) servers train speed is 20% slower.
descriptions.b_20_desc:
Once cavalry queued for training, their training time won't be changed disregarding of further changes in stable level, effect from artifacts or items(T4).
Even if stable would be demolished, cavalry training will be continued.
On classic (2.5) servers train speed is 20% slower.
descriptions.b_21_desc:
Once war machines queued for building, their building time won't be changed disregarding of future changes in workshop level or effect from artifacts.
Even if workshop would be demolished, constructing will be continued.
descriptions.b_22_desc: New types of troops are researched here. Researches remain after this building is torn down, but vanish after conquer.
descriptions.b_23_desc_t2:
Capacity for each of 4 resouce types. Gaulish cranny is 2x larger.
Crannies have 1/3 less capacity against teuton raids.
descriptions.b_23_desc:
Capacity for each of 4 resouce types. Gaulish cranny is 2x larger.
Crannies have 20% less capacity against teuton raids.
descriptions.b_23_desc_t4:
Capacity for each of 4 resouce types. Gaulish cranny is 2x larger.
Crannies have 20% less capacity against teuton raids with hero + 10-20% from any hero with sack item.
descriptions.b_23_desc_t44:
Capacity for each of 4 resouce types. Gaulish cranny is 1.5x larger.
Crannies have 20% less capacity against teuton raids with hero + 10-20% from any hero with sack item.
descriptions.b_24_desc:
Celebrations are kept here. Resources are taken before start and culture points are added after the end.
Great celebration increases effectiveness of administrators.
descriptions.b_25_desc:
Increases village defense a bit and opens access to 2 expansion slots: on 10th and 20th levels.
While not destroyed, prevents from loyalty descending in certain village and even increases it with rate = %*building level/hour.
Also its level affect train time of settlers and administrators.
descriptions.b_26_desc: Similar to residence, but gives an option to move your capital and extra expansion slot on 15<sup>th</sup> level.
descriptions.b_27_desc: Artifacts are kept here. In classic version max level is 10 and treasury couldn't be built in captial.
descriptions.b_28_desc:
Increase merchants' capacity by 10%/level.
Romans' merchants get 20% per level on non-classic servers.
descriptions.b_29_desc: Allows to build infantry simultaneously with normal barracks, but for 3x more resources, resulting in up to 2x speed for up to 4x cost
descriptions.b_30_desc: The same as great barracks, but for cavalry.
descriptions.b_31_desc: 1x durability. Disappears after conquering of the village.
descriptions.b_32_desc: 5x durability. Disappears after conquering of the village.
descriptions.b_33_desc: 2x durability. Disappears after conquering of the village.
descriptions.b_34_desc:
Increases durability of all buildings in capital, including resourcefields and wall.
It is always the last building destroyed by catapults. If village is affected by random targets artifact, it is the last building among inner ones (i.e. excluding resourcefields)
descriptions.b_35_desc: If you change level of a brewery after start of celebration, this will have no effect on started celebration.
descriptions.b_36_desc: Multiple trappers don't build/repair traps simultaneously. Repair time is always 1 minute and doesn't depend on server speed or level of trapper.
descriptions.b_37_desc:
In T4 adventures spawn around villages, which have this building and
Capital is always considered as having this building.
descriptions.b_38_desc:
Just a 3 times larger warehouse. Can be built either in WW village, or in villages affected by special artifact.
In second case, artifact is required not only for constructing of 1st level.
descriptions.b_39_desc:
Just a 3 times larger granary. Can be built either in WW village, or in villages affected by special artifact.
In second case, artifact is required not only for constructing of 1st level.
descriptions.b_41_desc:
Increases training speed of roman cavalry in certain village.
Decreases crop consumption of roman cavalry, fed (supplied) from that village.
descriptions.b_42k_desc: Provides additional defense. Cannot be destroyed by rams or catapults. Available only in cities.
descriptions.b_42_desc: 5x durability. Disappears after conquering of the village.
descriptions.b_43_desc: 1x durability. Disappears after conquering of the village.
descriptions.b_44_desc: Best of Residence and Palace: 3 chiefs, can be built in every village.

names.item_58: Short sword of the Teutonic Knight
names.item_60: Long sword of the Teutonic Knight

bonuses.ib_cav: Training time in stable reduced by {0}%.
bonuses.ib_inf: Training time in barracks reduced by {0}%.
bonuses.ib_111: Instantly gives amount of CP, equal to daily production, but not more than 5000.
bonuses.ib_114: 1 animal can be caught in oases

notes.item_note_1: Effect of this item is halved on 3x servers.
notes.item_note_2: Effect of this item is doubled on 3x servers.
notes.item_note_3: Gaulish heroes got +5 (+10 on 3x) to speed on horse.
notes.item_note_map: Map works only for the way back

terms.name: name
terms.ups_made: Upgrades made in blacksmith or/and armoury.

new villages: Culture points needed for additional villages

warsim.title: Extended Combat Simulator
warsim.none_return: none of your soldiers have returned
warsim.rp_not_demolished: Residence or palace are still not destroyed
warsim.sim_inacc_due: Simulation may be inaccurate due to next reason(s):
warsim.no_off_pop: You have not input population of attacker's account
warsim.no_def_pop: You have not input population of defender's account
warsim.no_off_ups: You have not input attacker's upgrades, his/her troops seemes to have, though
warsim.no_def_ups: You have not input attacker's upgrades, his/her troops seemes to have, though
warsim.cages_work_only_oas: Cages work only in attack of unoccupied oasis with animals
warsim.cages_work_only_hero: Cages work only when hero attacks alone
warsim.not_for_raid: Special abilities of rams, catapults and chiefs do not "work" in raid

controls.paste: paste line with numbers of units here

options.tab_stop_caption:
stop on block control group
(up, down, etc)
options.tab_stop_spec:
stop on unit-specific inputs
(scout art, cata targets, party)

report.rescued_alive: You freed {0} own troops, but could save only {1}
report.rescued+: You freed {0} own and {1} friendly troops
report.loyalied_sim: Loyalty reduced by value from {0} to {1}

conq_chance: Chance of conquering on this attack
conq_desc: Account's population should be input. Exact formula for loyalty descending is uknown and may result in error for about 1–2% in rare (1:1000) cases.
select_speed_by_unit: Select speed by choosing slowest unit:
thanx_to_data_providers: Thanks to all, who helps me to collect data.
desc_build_order: the most effective order of resource buildings development
desc_culture: two tables: specific increase of CP & amounts, needed to obtain new villages
desc_unit_calc: you can easily calculate, which troops has a best def-to-upkeep rate. And even more complex characteristics
desc_using: This site is heavily javascripted. If your browser doesn't support javascript or it is disabled, then you cannot use most of site's features.
desc_copy: All rights to most images on this site belongs to Travian Games Gmbh. The other images is mine. If you plan to use some pictures, contact above mentioned company.
desc_donations: If you would like to support this site not only with ideas, you may do so.
donate_details_server: it has a lot of hardware, which help site working
donate_details_cola: it has a lot of sugar, which helps in brain work ;-)
desc_multi_instances: After developing this building to maximum level, you'll be able to build several buildings of this type
desc_one_per_account: You can have only one such building per account.

ww-feed.feed_description:
Ctrl+A and Ctrl+C on marketplace page
then Ctrl+V here.
ww-feed.feed_bookmarklet_desc: This is a bookmarklet (wiki). You'd better drag it to bookmark panel and use to update crop on WW in one click (should be on marketplace page).
